column4: I need help. I am having External Drive mount problems. Every time I try plug in a flash drive, external hard drive, or external cd-rom I get a mount error.
sudo apt-get install pmount; edit /etc/pmount.allow
did you edit pmount.allow ?
I guess I am not sure what that is
did you read my response. i asked you to install pmount and then edit /etc/pmount.allow to allow your user to mount. after that your mounting blues would go away
I ran the install pmount, and then ran sudo edit /etc/pmount.allow. and I still get mount error
did  you actually edit that file or just ran the command??
can type sudo gedit /etc/pmount.allow? it should open up the default gnome editor  with the file
add your device name there like /dev/sdb1 (whatever applies to the device you are trying to mount)
how do I find out the name?
as soon as you plugged in the device, the last few lines of dmesg should tell you
sorry for my noobness but how do I see the dmesg
type dmesg inside a terminal
I see a vast amount of lines of text, I don't really know what I am looking for..
the last few lines (if you just plugged in your external disk) should say something like USB disk found; partitions sdb1 etc
other option is to type sudo fdisk -l after you plug in the device
okay so when I add "/dev/sdb1" to the list do I have to add a # before it, or just add it in on the next line
the # is a comment; so you dont add it
yes
I still seem to be getting the same error
maybe I am giving it the wrong name from dmesg
